thread.title: John Lackey hasn't pitched on three-days rest in 10 years
thread.title_full: John Lackey hasn't pitched on three-days rest in 10 years | Chicago Sun-Times

title: John Lackey hasn't pitched on three-days rest in 10 years
text:
Some view it as a strategic move by Cardinals manager Mike Matheny. Others might see it as desperation. Either way, the Cardinals have opted to start John Lackey on three-days rest for Game 4 of the NLDS against the Cubs on Tuesday.
Down 2-1 in the series, it makes sense the Cards would hand the ball to their most consistent, playoff-tested pitcher in a win-or-go-home game. Or does it?
SLIDESHOW: 10 most-asked Google questions about Cubs, Cardinals
The 36-year-old has pitched just four games on three days rest in his 14-year career, the last coming in the 2005 playoffs.
From Gordon Wittenmyer of the Chicago Sun-Times:
Lackey, who missed 2012 because of Tommy John surgery, has pitched on three days’ rest only four times in his career, including twice in the postseason. He’s 2-1 with a 3.15 ERA in those four starts (including a Game 7 World Series start as a rookie in 2002). But he hasn’t done it since the 2005 playoffs against the Yankees.
